Articles.Content: Seveneves is by Neal Stephenson and is one of the only sci-if books that I know of that respects orbital mechanics and is not a textbook. But, it's by Neal Stephenson(cryptonomicon guy) meaning that it's roughly the length of three regular novels. Oh and half of it is depressing.

Yes! Good book.

Sadly the last [thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123033-Seveneves?p=1970646&viewfull=1#post1970646) dried up ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Just finished it last night. I'm a huge Neal Stephenson fan, and this one did not disappoint. But, yeah, first two-thirds of the book was all: 

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Zp73CJyCp5Q?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
Combined with some of the original Snow White story. (Aida and the caniballism)
